Linux.text:
How often my system is backed up?
 >On Lapos Bacula is installed and a backup is running automatically once a day.
 >It is possible to install Bacula on LDT SLES 12 and RHEL 7.
>More information can be found in this announcement:
 https://jam4.sapjam.com/blogs/show/tiKMmu1xeRAKaIIFQ0NYhy

 *How can I restore my data?*
>Please follow this document to learn how to restore your data backed up with Bacula on Lapos:
 https://jam4.sapjam.com/groups/0axcizqx9pZUmnJNUgGBT6/documents/MQqRGimSW4h1mMn9o6u1tO/slide_viewer

Windows.text: Backup and restore files on your Windows

Linux.text:
Is there a Single Sign On (SSO) on Linux?*

>Yes and No.
>You can import your personal certificate to FireFox in order to enable SSO for Corporate web applications.
 >But SSO is not supported natively on Linux images (e.g. local SAP GUI installation)

link.text: (page 3 - 6) describes how to do SSO on Firefox

Windows.text: SSO app is installed by default on SAP images. in case your SSO certificate is missing:

Linux.text:
How can I use the SAP GUI on SAP Linux image (Lapos)?*

>There is already a SAP Gui installed on Lapos.

Windows.text: You can find the SAP GUI under SoftwareCorner app:

link.text: SAP GUI for Java Setup - macOS

Linux.text:
Can I access Office applications from Linux?
>Yes you can! Microsoft Office applications are accessible from Lapos as *Published Apps*.
>Outlook, Excel, Word and Powerpoint icon shortcuts accessible directly from the Lapos desktop.
>The Office apps can also be accessible from this link:

How can I logon to my Linux system?

 Just check if your Active Directory (D/I/C) user is *enabled for Linux* usage. For this you can use the following tool

macOS.text: How to login to the domain:

Linux.text:
Is it possible to install other web browsers on Linux?

>Lapos is delivered with Firefox by default.
>If needed a different browser (if SWAP approved) can be installed, but without IT support

How can I remotely connect from my Linux device?
 
On Lapos there is a VPN client installed, 
>please follow this document to learn how to establish VPN connection:

getJavaInfo:
Is Java engine installed on SAP image?
>Yes, SAP Java engine is already installed on SAP image.
>If needed, it can be uninstalled and a different Java version can be installed
